servinfo.title: DTC B1053 / B1057: Driver / Passenger Pretensioner Initiator Circuit Short to Ground

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC B1051 / B1055: Driver / Passenger Pretensioner Initiator Circuit Resistance High .

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to observe instructions under CAUTION in “Air Bag Diagnostic System Check Flow”.

servinfosub.title: DTC Will Set when
servinfosub.ptxt: The voltage measured at driver or passenger seat belt pretensioner initiator circuit is below a specified value for specified time.

ptxt.emph: Step 1: Check if malfunction is in seat belt pretensioner.
Step 2: Check seat belt pretensioner initiator circuit. (Between “L29” and “L12” or “L29” and “L36”)
Step 3: Check seat belt pretensioner initiator circuit. (Between “G55” and “G47”, “L12” and “L33” or “L36” and “L33”)

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, remove center pillar lower trim of driver or passenger side and disconnect seat belt pretensioner connector “L12” or “L36” (1).
Check proper connection to seat belt pretensioner at terminals in “L12” or “L36” connector.
If OK, then connect special tools (A), (B) and (C) to “L12” or “L36” connector disconnected in Step 1).

testgroup.question: With ignition switch ON, is DTC B1053 or B1057 still indicated?

paragroup.ptxt: Without side-air bag and curtain-air bag: go to Step 2.
With side-air bag and curtain-air bag: go to Step 3.
Ignition switch OFF. Replace seat belt pretensioner referring to Front Seat Belt Removal and Installation .

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect “G55” connector located near the console box.
Check proper connection to applicable seat belt pretensioner at terminal in “G55” connector.
If OK, then connect special tools (B) and (D) to “G55” connector.

testgroup.question: With ignition switch ON, is DTC B1053 or B1057 still indicated?

paragroup.ptxt: DTC B1053: “GRN/ORN” or “GRN/YEL” circuit shorted to ground. (Between “L29” and “L12” connectors)
DTC B1057: “BLU/ORN” circuit or “BLU/YEL” circuit shorted to ground. (Between “L29” and “L36” connectors)

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect special tools (A), (B) and (C) or (D) and SDM connector “G47” or “L33”.
Release shorting bar in SDM connector inserting release tool (1) included in special tool (A).

Measure resistance between “G47-7” and body ground, “G47-8” and body ground (for DTC B1053) or “G47-1” and body ground, “G47-2” and body ground (for DTC B1057) [A], or between “L33-5” and body ground, “L33-6” and body ground (for DTC B1053) or “L33-7” and body ground, “L33-8” and body ground (for DTC B1057) [B].

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good SDM and recheck.

paragroup.ptxt: DTC B1053: “GRN/ORN” circuit or “GRN/YEL” circuit shorted to ground. (Between “G55” and “G47” connectors or between “L12” and “L33” connectors)
DTC B1057: “BLU/ORN” circuit or “BLU/YEL” circuit shorted to ground. (Between “G55” and “G47” connectors or between “L36” and “L33” connectors)

attention3.ptxt: Upon completion of inspection and repair work, perform the following items.

item.ptxt: Reconnect all air bag system components and ensure all components are properly mounted.
Clear DTCs referring to DTC Clearance , if any.
Repeat Air Bag Diagnostic System Check to confirm that the trouble has been corrected.
